contentrichtext.text: '''Xavier Beitia''' (born 1982-11-23) is an [[American football]] [[placekicker]] who last played for the [[Georgia Force]] of the [[Arena Football League (1987â€“2008)|Arena Football League]] (AFL) in 2007. He played [[college football]] at [[Florida State Seminoles football|Florida State]] and signed with the [[New York Jets]] in 2004 and [[Tampa Bay Buccaneers]] in 2006. Within NFL Europe, he played for the [[Berlin Thunder]]. ==High school years== Beitia attended [[Jesuit High School of Tampa]] in [[Tampa, Florida]] and kicked for coach Dominic Ciao. While in high school, he participated in the first ever [[U.S. Army All-American Bowl]] game in 2000. ==College career== At Florida State, Beitia was well known for having missed a potential game-winning field goal against [[Miami Hurricanes football|Miami (Fla.)]]. The kick went wide left as time expired in 2002, in what would continue the bizarre "[[Wide Right (Florida State)|Wide Right]]" saga. Beitia's miss at the [[Miami Orange Bowl]] was dubbed "[[Wide Left I(Florida State)#Wide Left I|Wide Left I]]," and it affected him openly and deeply.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.sptimes.com/2002/10/13/Columns/For_FSU__same_sadness.shtml|title=For FSU, same sadness, but deeper|author=Gary Shelton|publisher=St. Petersburg Times|date=2002-10-13|accessdate=2010-09-26}}</ref> More than one year later, Beitia missed another field goal in the [[Orange Bowl (game)|2004 Orange Bowl]] which would have given the Noles the lead with about five minutes left. The Miami Hurricanes went on to win that game, 16-14. ==Professional career== In 2004, he signed with the New York Jets. In 2006, Xavier became a member of the Tampa Bay Buccaneers being used as a punter, but not for field goals. Tampa Bay sent him to NFL Europe that year, where he played for the Berlin Thunder. He was released by Tampa Bay in August 2006.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9407E2D8113EF933A0575BC0A9609C8B63|title=Transactions|publisher=New York Times|date=2006-08-30|accessdate=2010-09-26}}</ref> Beitia went on to become a kicker for in the AFL for the Georgia Force, before being waived in May 2007.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://findarticles.com/p/news-articles/charleston-gazette-the/mi_8022/is_20070508/transactions/ai_n43247353/|title=Transactions|publisher=[[Charleston Gazette]]|date=2007-05-08|accessdate=2010-09-26}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.arenafan.com/players/?page=players&player=10513 Stats from ArenaFan.com] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Beitia, Xavier | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American football player | DATE OF BIRTH = 1982 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Beitia, Xavier}} [[Category:1982 births]] [[Category:American football placekickers]] [[Category:Florida State Seminoles football players]] [[Category:Georgia Force players]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Sportspeople from Tampa, Florida]] [[Category:U.S. Army All-American football players]] {{amfoot-kicker-stub}} {{ArenaFootballLeague-stub}}
